   20: -module(tar_SUITE).
   21: 
   22: -export([all/0, suite/0,groups/0,init_per_suite/1, end_per_suite/1, 
   23: 	 init_per_group/2, end_per_group/2,
   24:          init_per_testcase/2,
   25:          borderline/1, atomic/1, long_names/1,
   26: 	 create_long_names/1, bad_tar/1, errors/1, extract_from_binary/1,
   27: 	 extract_from_binary_compressed/1, extract_filtered/1,
   28: 	 extract_from_open_file/1, symlinks/1, open_add_close/1, cooked_compressed/1,
   29: 	 memory/1,unicode/1,read_other_implementations/1,bsdtgz/1,
   30:          sparse/1, init/1, leading_slash/1, dotdot/1,
   31:          roundtrip_metadata/1, apply_file_info_opts/1,
   32:          incompatible_options/1]).
   33: 
   34: -include_lib("common_test/include/ct.hrl").
   35: -include_lib("kernel/include/file.hrl").
   36: 
   37: suite() -> [{ct_hooks,[ts_install_cth]}].
   38: 
   39: all() -> 
   40:     [borderline, atomic, long_names, create_long_names,
   41:      bad_tar, errors, extract_from_binary,
   42:      extract_from_binary_compressed, extract_from_open_file,
   43:      extract_filtered,
   44:      symlinks, open_add_close, cooked_compressed, memory, unicode,
   45:      read_other_implementations, bsdtgz,
   46:      sparse,init,leading_slash,dotdot,roundtrip_metadata,
   47:      apply_file_info_opts,incompatible_options].
   48: 
   49: groups() -> 
   50:     [].
   51: 
   52: init_per_suite(Config) ->
   53:     uid_config(Config).
   54: 
   55: end_per_suite(_Config) ->
   56:     ok.
   57: 
   58: init_per_group(_GroupName, Config) ->
   59:     Config.
   60: 
   61: end_per_group(_GroupName, Config) ->
   62:     Config.
   63: 
   64: init_per_testcase(_Case, Config) ->
   65:     Ports = ordsets:from_list(erlang:ports()),
   66:     [{ports,Ports}|Config].
   67: 
   68: %% Test creating, listing and extracting one file from an archive,
   69: %% multiple times with different file sizes.  Also check that the file
   70: %% attributes of the extracted file has survived.
   71: borderline(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
   72: 
   73:     %% Note: We cannot use absolute paths, because the pathnames will be
   74:     %% too long for the limit allowed in tar files (100 characters).
   75:     %% Therefore, strip off the current working directory from the front
   76:     %% of the private directory path.
   77: 
   78:     {ok, Cwd} = file:get_cwd(),
   79:     RootDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
   80:     TempDir = remove_prefix(Cwd++"/", filename:join(RootDir, "borderline")),
   81:     ok = file:make_dir(TempDir),
   82: 
   83:     Record = 512,
   84:     Block = 20 * Record,
   85: 
   86:     lists:foreach(fun(Size) -> borderline_test(Size, TempDir, Config) end,
   87: 		  [0, 1, 10, 13, 127, 333, Record-1, Record, Record+1,
   88: 		   Block-2*Record-1, Block-2*Record, Block-2*Record+1,
   89: 		   Block-Record-1, Block-Record, Block-Record+1,
   90: 		   Block-1, Block, Block+1,
   91: 		   Block+Record-1, Block+Record, Block+Record+1]),
   92: 
   93:     %% Clean up.
   94:     delete_files([TempDir]),
   95: 
   96:     verify_ports(Config).
   97: 
   98: borderline_test(Size, TempDir, Config) ->
   99:     io:format("Testing size ~p", [Size]),
  100:     case long_uid(Config) of
  101:         true -> ok;
  102:         false -> borderline_test1(Size, TempDir, true)
  103:     end,
  104:     borderline_test1(Size, TempDir, false),
  105:     ok.
  106: 
  107: borderline_test1(Size, TempDir, IsUstar) ->
  108:     Prefix = case IsUstar of
  109:                  true ->
  110:                      "file_";
  111:                  false ->
  112:                      lists:duplicate(100, $f) ++ "ile_"
  113:              end,
  114:     SizeList = integer_to_list(Size),
  115:     Archive = filename:join(TempDir, "ar_"++ SizeList ++".tar"),
  116:     Name = filename:join(TempDir, Prefix++SizeList),
  117: 
  118:     %% Create a file and archive it.
  119:     RandomBytes = rand:bytes(Size),
  120:     ok = file:write_file(Name, RandomBytes),
  121:     ok = erl_tar:create(Archive, [Name]),
  122:     ok = file:delete(Name),
  123: 
  124:     %% Verify listing and extracting.
  125:     IsUstar = is_ustar(Archive),
  126:     {ok, [Name]} = erl_tar:table(Archive),
  127:     ok = erl_tar:extract(Archive, [verbose]),
  128: 
  129:     %% Verify contents of extracted file.
  130:     {ok, Bin} = file:read_file(Name),
  131:     RandomBytes = Bin,
  132: 
  133:     %% Verify that Unix tar can read it.
  134:     case IsUstar of
  135:         true ->
  136:             tar_tf(Archive, Name);
  137:         false ->
  138:             ok
  139:     end,
  140: 
  141:     ok.
  142: 
  143: tar_tf(Archive, Name) ->
  144:     case os:type() of
  145: 	{unix, _} ->
  146: 	    tar_tf1(Archive, Name);
  147: 	_ ->
  148: 	    ok
  149:     end.
  150: 
  151: tar_tf1(Archive, Name) ->
  152:     Expect = Name ++ "\n",
  153:     cmd_expect("tar tf " ++ Archive, Expect).
  154: 
  155: %% We can't use os:cmd/1, because Unix 'tar tf Name' on Solaris never
  156: %% terminates when given an archive of a size it doesn't like.
  157: 
  158: cmd_expect(Cmd, Expect) ->
  159:     Port = open_port({spawn, make_cmd(Cmd)}, [stream, in, eof]),
  160:     get_data(Port, Expect).
  161: 
  162: get_data(Port, Expect) ->
  163:     receive
  164: 	{Port, {data, Bytes}} ->
  165: 	    get_data(Port, match_output(Bytes, Expect, Port));
  166: 	{Port, eof} ->
  167: 	    Port ! {self(), close}, 
  168: 	    receive
  169: 		{Port, closed} ->
  170: 		    true
  171: 	    end, 
  172: 	    receive
  173: 		{'EXIT',  Port,  _} -> 
  174: 		    ok
  175: 	    after 1 ->				% force context switch
  176: 		    ok
  177: 	    end, 
  178: 	    match_output(eof, Expect, Port)
  179:     end.
  180: 
  181: match_output([C|Output], [C|Expect], Port) ->
  182:     match_output(Output, Expect, Port);
  183: match_output([_|_], [_|_], Port) ->
  184:     kill_port_and_fail(Port, badmatch);
  185: match_output([X|Output], [], Port) ->
  186:     kill_port_and_fail(Port, {too_much_data, [X|Output]});
  187: match_output([], Expect, _Port) ->
  188:     Expect;
  189: match_output(eof, [], _Port) ->
  190:     [];
  191: match_output(eof, _Expect, Port) ->
  192:     kill_port_and_fail(Port, unexpected_end_of_input).
  193: 
  194: kill_port_and_fail(Port, Reason) ->
  195:     unlink(Port),
  196:     exit(Port, die),
  197:     ct:fail(Reason).
  198: 
  199: make_cmd(Cmd) ->
  200:     case os:type() of
  201: 	{win32, _} -> lists:concat(["cmd /c",  Cmd]);
  202: 	{unix, _}  -> lists:concat(["sh -c '",  Cmd,  "'"])
  203:     end.
  204: 
  205: %% Test the 'atomic' operations: create/extract/table, on compressed
  206: %% and uncompressed archives.
  207: %% Also test the 'cooked' option.
  208: atomic(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  209:     ok = file:set_cwd(proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config)),
  210:     DataFiles = data_files(),
  211:     Names = [Name || {Name,_,_} <- DataFiles],
  212:     io:format("Names: ~p", [Names]),
  213: 
  214:     %% Create an uncompressed archive.  The compressed flag should still be
  215:     %% allowed when listing contents or extracting.
  216: 
  217:     Tar1 = "uncompressed.tar",
  218:     erl_tar:create(Tar1, Names, []),
  219:     {ok, Names} = erl_tar:table(Tar1, []),
  220:     {ok, Names} = erl_tar:table(Tar1, [compressed]),
  221:     {ok, Names} = erl_tar:table(Tar1, [cooked]),
  222:     {ok, Names} = erl_tar:table(Tar1, [compressed,cooked]),
  223: 
  224:     %% Create a compressed archive.
  225: 
  226:     Tar2 = "compressed.tar",
  227:     erl_tar:create(Tar2, Names, [compressed]),
  228:     {ok, Names} = erl_tar:table(Tar2, [compressed]),
  229:     {error, Reason} = erl_tar:table(Tar2, []),
  230:     {ok, Names} = erl_tar:table(Tar2, [compressed,cooked]),
  231:     {error, Reason} = erl_tar:table(Tar2, [cooked]),
  232:     ok = io:format("No compressed option: ~p, ~s",
  233: 		   [Reason, erl_tar:format_error(Reason)]),
  234: 
  235:     %% Same test again, but this time created with 'cooked'
  236: 
  237:     Tar3 = "uncompressed_cooked.tar",
  238:     erl_tar:create(Tar3, Names, [cooked]),
  239:     {ok, Names} = erl_tar:table(Tar3, []),
  240:     {ok, Names} = erl_tar:table(Tar3, [compressed]),
  241:     {ok, Names} = erl_tar:table(Tar3, [cooked]),
  242:     {ok, Names} = erl_tar:table(Tar3, [compressed,cooked]),
  243: 
  244:     Tar4 = "compressed_cooked.tar",
  245:     erl_tar:create(Tar4, Names, [compressed,cooked]),
  246:     {ok, Names} = erl_tar:table(Tar4, [compressed]),
  247:     {error, Reason} = erl_tar:table(Tar4, []),
  248:     {ok, Names} = erl_tar:table(Tar4, [compressed,cooked]),
  249:     {error, Reason} = erl_tar:table(Tar4, [cooked]),
  250:     ok = io:format("No compressed option: ~p, ~s",
  251: 		   [Reason, erl_tar:format_error(Reason)]),
  252: 
  253:     %% Clean up.
  254:     delete_files([Tar1,Tar2,Tar3,Tar4|Names]),
  255: 
  256:     verify_ports(Config).
  257: 
  258: %% Returns a sequence of characters.
  259: 
  260: char_seq(N, First) ->
  261:     char_seq(N, First, []).
  262: 
  263: char_seq(0, _, Result) ->
  264:     Result;
  265: char_seq(N, C, Result) when C < 127 ->
  266:     char_seq(N-1, C+1, [C|Result]);
  267: char_seq(N, _, Result) ->
  268:     char_seq(N, $!, Result).
  269: 
  270: data_files() ->
  271:     Files = [{"first_file", 1555, $a},
  272: 	     {"small_file", 7, $d},
  273: 	     {"big_file", 23875, $e},
  274: 	     {"last_file", 7500, $g}],
  275:     create_files(Files),
  276:     Files.
  277: 
  278: create_files([{Name, Size, First}|Rest]) ->
  279:     ok = file:write_file(Name, char_seq(Size, First)),
  280:     create_files(Rest);
  281: create_files([]) ->
  282:     ok.
  283: 
  284: %% Test to extract an Unix tar file containing filenames longer than
  285: %% 100 characters and empty directories.
  286: long_names(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  287:     DataDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
  288:     Long = filename:join(DataDir, "long_names.tar"),
  289:     run_in_short_tempdir(Config,
  290: 			 fun() -> do_long_names(Long) end),
  291:     verify_ports(Config).
  292: 
  293: 
  294: do_long_names(Long) ->
  295:     %% Try table/2 and extract/2.
  296:     case erl_tar:table(Long, [verbose]) of
  297: 	{ok,List} when is_list(List) ->
  298: 	    io:format("~p\n", [List])
  299:     end,
  300: 
  301:     {ok,Cwd} = file:get_cwd(),
  302:     ok = erl_tar:extract(Long),
  303:     Base = filename:join([Cwd, "original_software", "written_by",
  304: 			  "a_bunch_of_hackers",
  305: 			  "spending_all_their_nights",
  306: 			  "still", "not_long_enough",
  307: 			  "but_soon_it_will_be"]),
  308: 
  309:     %% Verify that the empty directory was created.
  310:     EmptyDir = filename:join(Base, "empty_directory"),
  311:     {ok, #file_info{type=directory}} = file:read_file_info(EmptyDir),
  312: 
  313:     %% Verify that the files were created.
  314:     {ok,First} = file:read_file(filename:join(Base, "first_file")),
  315:     {ok,Second} = file:read_file(filename:join(Base, "second_file")),
  316:     "Here"++_ = binary_to_list(First),
  317:     "And"++_ = binary_to_list(Second),
  318: 
  319:     ok.
  320: 
  321: %% Creates a tar file from a deep directory structure (filenames are
  322: %% longer than 100 characters).
  323: create_long_names(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  324:     run_in_short_tempdir(Config, fun create_long_names/0),
  325:     verify_ports(Config).
  326: 
  327: create_long_names() ->
  328:     {ok,Dir} = file:get_cwd(),
  329:     Dirs = ["aslfjkshjkhliuf",
  330: 	    "asdhjfehnbfsky",
  331: 	    "sahajfskdfhsz",
  332: 	    "asldfkdlfy4y8rchg",
  333: 	    "f7nafhjgffagkhsfkhsjk",
  334: 	    "dfjasldkfjsdkfjashbv"],
  335: 
  336:     DeepDir = make_dirs(Dirs, []),
  337:     AFile = filename:join(DeepDir, "a_file"),
  338:     Hello = "hello, world\n",
  339:     ok = file:write_file(AFile, Hello),
  340:     TarName = filename:join(Dir,  "my_tar_with_long_names.tar"),
  341:     ok = erl_tar:create(TarName, [AFile]),
  342: 
  343:     %% Print contents.
  344:     ok = erl_tar:tt(TarName),
  345: 
  346:     %% Extract and verify.
  347:     ExtractDir = "extract_dir",
  348:     ok = file:make_dir(ExtractDir),
  349:     ok = erl_tar:extract(TarName, [{cwd,ExtractDir}]),
  350:     {ok, Bin} = file:read_file(filename:join(ExtractDir, AFile)),
  351:     Hello = binary_to_list(Bin),
  352: 
  353:     ok.
  354: 
  355: make_dirs([Dir|Rest], []) ->
  356:     ok = file:make_dir(Dir),
  357:     make_dirs(Rest, Dir);
  358: make_dirs([Dir|Rest], Parent) ->
  359:     Name = filename:join(Parent, Dir),
  360:     ok = file:make_dir(Name),
  361:     make_dirs(Rest, Name);
  362: make_dirs([], Dir) ->
  363:     Dir.
  364: 
  365: %% Try erl_tar:table/2 and erl_tar:extract/2 on some corrupted tar files.
  366: bad_tar(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  367:     try_bad("bad_checksum", bad_header, Config),
  368:     try_bad("bad_octal",    invalid_tar_checksum, Config),
  369:     try_bad("bad_too_short",    eof, Config),
  370:     try_bad("bad_even_shorter", eof, Config),
  371:     verify_ports(Config).
  372: 
  373: try_bad(Name0, Reason, Config) ->
  374:     %% Intentionally no macros here.
  375: 
  376:     DataDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
  377:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  378:     Name = Name0 ++ ".tar",
  379:     io:format("~nTrying ~s", [Name]),
  380:     Full = filename:join(DataDir, Name),
  381:     Dest = filename:join(PrivDir, Name0),
  382:     Opts = [verbose, {cwd, Dest}],
  383:     Expected = {error, Reason},
  384:     io:fwrite("Expected: ~p\n", [Expected]),
  385:     case {erl_tar:table(Full, Opts), erl_tar:extract(Full, Opts)} of
  386: 	{Expected, Expected} ->
  387: 	    io:format("Result: ~p", [Expected]),
  388: 	    case catch erl_tar:format_error(Reason) of
  389: 		{'EXIT', CrashReason} ->
  390: 		    ct:fail({format_error, crashed, CrashReason});
  391: 		String when is_list(String) ->
  392: 		    io:format("format_error(~p) -> ~s", [Reason, String]);
  393: 		Other ->
  394: 		    ct:fail({format_error, returned, Other})
  395: 	    end;
  396: 	{Other1, Other2} ->
  397: 	    io:format("table/2 returned ~p", [Other1]),
  398: 	    io:format("extract/2 returned ~p", [Other2]),
  399: 	    ct:fail({bad_return_value, Other1, Other2})
  400:     end.
  401: 
  402: %% Tests that some common errors return correct error codes
  403: %% and that format_error/1 handles them correctly.
  404: errors(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  405:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  406: 
  407:     %% Give the tar file the same name as a directory.
  408:     BadTar = filename:join(PrivDir, "bad_tarfile.tar"),
  409:     ok = file:make_dir(BadTar),
  410:     try_error(erl_tar, create, [BadTar, []], {BadTar, eisdir}),
  411: 
  412:     %% Try including non-existent files in the tar file.
  413:     NonExistent = "non_existent_file",
  414:     GoodTar = filename:join(PrivDir, "a_good_tarfile.tar"),
  415:     try_error(erl_tar, create, [GoodTar, [NonExistent]],
  416: 	      {NonExistent, enoent}),
  417: 
  418:     %% Clean up.
  419:     delete_files([GoodTar,BadTar]),
  420: 
  421:     verify_ports(Config).
  422: 
  423: try_error(M, F, A, Error) ->
  424:     io:format("Trying ~p:~p(~p)", [M, F, A]),
  425:     case catch apply(M, F, A) of
  426: 	{'EXIT', Reason} ->
  427: 	    exit(Reason);
  428: 	ok ->
  429: 	    ct:fail(unexpected_success);
  430: 	{error, Error} ->
  431: 	    case catch erl_tar:format_error(Error) of
  432: 		{'EXIT', FReason} ->
  433: 		    ct:fail({format_error, crashed, FReason});
  434: 		String when is_list(String) ->
  435: 		    io:format("format_error(~p) -> ~s", [Error, String]);
  436: 		Other ->
  437: 		    ct:fail({format_error, returned, Other})
  438: 	    end;
  439: 	Other ->
  440: 	    ct:fail({expected, {error, Error}, actual, Other})
  441:     end.
  442: 
  443: %% remove_prefix(Prefix, List) -> ListWithoutPrefix.
  444: 
  445: remove_prefix([C|Rest1], [C|Rest2]) ->
  446:     remove_prefix(Rest1, Rest2);
  447: remove_prefix(_, Result) ->
  448:     Result.
  449: 
  450: %% Test extracting a tar archive from a binary.
  451: extract_from_binary(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  452:     DataDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
  453:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  454:     Long = filename:join(DataDir, "no_fancy_stuff.tar"),
  455:     ExtractDir = filename:join(PrivDir, "extract_from_binary"),
  456:     ok = file:make_dir(ExtractDir),
  457: 
  458:     %% Read a tar file into a binary and extract from the binary.
  459:     {ok, Bin} = file:read_file(Long),
  460:     ok = erl_tar:extract({binary, Bin}, [{cwd,ExtractDir}]),
  461: 
  462:     %% Verify.
  463:     Dir = filename:join(ExtractDir, "no_fancy_stuff"),
  464:     true = filelib:is_dir(Dir),
  465:     true = filelib:is_file(filename:join(Dir, "a_dir_list")),
  466:     true = filelib:is_file(filename:join(Dir, "EPLICENCE")),
  467: 
  468:     %% Clean up.
  469:     delete_files([ExtractDir]),
  470: 
  471:     verify_ports(Config).
  472: 
  473: extract_from_binary_compressed(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  474:     %% Test extracting a compressed tar archive from a binary.
  475:     DataDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
  476:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  477:     Name = filename:join(DataDir, "cooked_tar_problem.tar.gz"),
  478:     ExtractDir = filename:join(PrivDir, "extract_from_binary_compressed"),
  479:     ok = file:make_dir(ExtractDir),
  480:     {ok,Bin} = file:read_file(Name),
  481: 
  482:     %% Try taking contents.
  483:     {ok,Files} = erl_tar:table({binary,Bin}, [compressed]),
  484:     io:format("~p\n", [Files]),
  485:     19 = length(Files),
  486: 
  487:     %% Try taking contents when already uncompressed.
  488:     {ok,Files} = erl_tar:table({binary,zlib:gunzip(Bin)}, [compressed]),
  489:     io:format("~p\n", [Files]),
  490:     19 = length(Files),
  491: 
  492:     %% Trying extracting from a binary.
  493:     ok = erl_tar:extract({binary,Bin}, [compressed,{cwd,ExtractDir}]),
  494:     {ok,List} = file:list_dir(filename:join(ExtractDir, "ddll_SUITE_data")),
  495:     io:format("~p\n", [List]),
  496:     19 = length(List),
  497: 
  498:     %% Clean up while at the same time testing that all file
  499:     %% were extracted as expected.
  500:     lists:foreach(fun(N) ->
  501: 			  File = filename:join(ExtractDir, N),
  502: 			  io:format("Deleting: ~p\n", [File]),
  503: 			  ok = file:delete(File)
  504: 		  end, Files),
  505: 
  506:     %% Clean up the rest.
  507:     delete_files([ExtractDir]),
  508: 
  509:     verify_ports(Config).
  510: 
  511: %% Test extracting a tar archive from a binary.
  512: extract_filtered(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  513:     DataDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
  514:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  515:     Long = filename:join(DataDir, "no_fancy_stuff.tar"),
  516:     ExtractDir = filename:join(PrivDir, "extract_from_binary"),
  517:     ok = file:make_dir(ExtractDir),
  518: 
  519:     ok = erl_tar:extract(Long, [{cwd,ExtractDir},{files,["no_fancy_stuff/EPLICENCE"]}]),
  520: 
  521:     %% Verify.
  522:     Dir = filename:join(ExtractDir, "no_fancy_stuff"),
  523:     true = filelib:is_dir(Dir),
  524:     false = filelib:is_file(filename:join(Dir, "a_dir_list")),
  525:     true = filelib:is_file(filename:join(Dir, "EPLICENCE")),
  526: 
  527:     %% Clean up.
  528:     delete_files([ExtractDir]),
  529: 
  530:     verify_ports(Config).
  531: 
  532: %% Test extracting a tar archive from an open file.
  533: extract_from_open_file(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  534:     DataDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
  535:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  536:     Long = filename:join(DataDir, "no_fancy_stuff.tar"),
  537:     ExtractDir = filename:join(PrivDir, "extract_from_open_file"),
  538:     ok = file:make_dir(ExtractDir),
  539: 
  540:     {ok, File} = file:open(Long, [read]),
  541:     ok = erl_tar:extract({file, File}, [{cwd,ExtractDir}]),
  542: 
  543:     %% Verify.
  544:     Dir = filename:join(ExtractDir, "no_fancy_stuff"),
  545:     true = filelib:is_dir(Dir),
  546:     true = filelib:is_file(filename:join(Dir, "a_dir_list")),
  547:     true = filelib:is_file(filename:join(Dir, "EPLICENCE")),
  548: 
  549:     %% Close open file.
  550:     ok = file:close(File),
  551: 
  552:     %% Clean up.
  553:     delete_files([ExtractDir]),
  554: 
  555:     verify_ports(Config).
  556: 
  557: %% Make sure incompatible options are rejected when opening archives with file
  558: %% descriptors.
  559: incompatible_options(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  560:     DataDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
  561:     Long = filename:join(DataDir, "no_fancy_stuff.tar"),
  562: 
  563:     {ok, File} = file:open(Long, [read]),
  564:     Handle = {file, File},
  565: 
  566:     {error, {Handle, {incompatible_option, compressed}}}
  567:         = erl_tar:open(Handle, [read, compressed]),
  568:     {error, {Handle, {incompatible_option, cooked}}}
  569:         = erl_tar:open(Handle, [read, cooked]),
  570: 
  571:     {error, {Handle, {incompatible_option, compressed}}}
  572:         = erl_tar:extract(Handle, [compressed]),
  573:     {error, {Handle, {incompatible_option, cooked}}}
  574:         = erl_tar:extract(Handle, [cooked]),
  575: 
  576:     ok = file:close(File),
  577: 
  578:     verify_ports(Config).
  579: 
  580: %% Test that archives containing symlinks can be created and extracted.
  581: symlinks(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  582:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  583:     Dir = filename:join(PrivDir, "symlinks"),
  584:     VulnerableDir = filename:join(PrivDir, "vulnerable_symlinks"),
  585:     ok = file:make_dir(Dir),
  586:     ok = file:make_dir(VulnerableDir),
  587:     ABadSymlink = filename:join(Dir, "bad_symlink"),
  588:     PointsTo = "a/definitely/non_existing/path",
  589:     Res = case make_symlink("a/definitely/non_existing/path", ABadSymlink) of
  590: 	      {error, enotsup} ->
  591: 		  {skip, "Symbolic links not supported on this platform"};
  592: 	      ok ->
  593: 		  symlinks(Dir, "bad_symlink", PointsTo, Config),
  594: 		  long_symlink(Dir),
  595:                   symlink_vulnerability(VulnerableDir)
  596: 	  end,
  597: 
  598:     %% Clean up.
  599:     delete_files([Dir,VulnerableDir]),
  600:     verify_ports(Config),
  601:     Res.
  602: 
  603: make_symlink(Path, Link) ->
  604:     case os:type() of
  605: 	{win32,_} ->
  606: 	    %% Symlinks on Windows have two problems:
  607: 	    %%   1) file:read_link_info/1 cannot read out the target
  608: 	    %%      of the symlink if the target does not exist.
  609: 	    %%      That is possible (but not easy) to fix in the
  610: 	    %%      efile driver.
  611: 	    %%
  612: 	    %%   2) Symlinks to files and directories are different
  613: 	    %%      creatures. If the target is not existing, the
  614: 	    %%      symlink will be created to be of the file-pointing
  615: 	    %%      type. That can be partially worked around in erl_tar
  616: 	    %%      by creating all symlinks when the end of the tar
  617: 	    %%      file has been reached.
  618: 	    %%
  619: 	    %% But for now, pretend that there are no symlinks on
  620: 	    %% Windows.
  621: 	    {error, enotsup};
  622: 	_ ->
  623: 	    file:make_symlink(Path, Link)
  624:     end.
  625: 
  626: symlinks(Dir, BadSymlink, PointsTo, Config) ->
  627:     Tar = filename:join(Dir, "symlink.tar"),
  628:     DerefTar = filename:join(Dir, "dereference.tar"),
  629: 
  630:     %% Create the archive.
  631: 
  632:     ok = file:set_cwd(Dir),
  633:     GoodSymlink = "good_symlink",
  634:     AFile = "a_good_file",
  635:     ALine = "A line of text for a file.",
  636:     ok = file:write_file(AFile, ALine),
  637:     ok = file:make_symlink(AFile, GoodSymlink),
  638:     ok = erl_tar:create(Tar, [BadSymlink, GoodSymlink, AFile], [verbose]),
  639: 
  640:     %% List contents of tar file.
  641: 
  642:     ok = erl_tar:tt(Tar),
  643: 
  644:     %% Also create another archive with the dereference flag.
  645: 
  646:     ok = erl_tar:create(DerefTar, [AFile, GoodSymlink], [dereference, verbose]),
  647:     case long_uid(Config) of
  648:         true -> ok;
  649:         false ->
  650:             true = is_ustar(Tar),
  651:             true = is_ustar(DerefTar)
  652:     end,
  653: 
  654:     %% Extract files to a new directory.
  655: 
  656:     NewDir = filename:join(Dir, "extracted"),
  657:     ok = file:make_dir(NewDir),
  658:     ok = erl_tar:extract(Tar, [{cwd, NewDir}, verbose]),
  659: 
  660:     %% Verify that the files are there.
  661: 
  662:     ok = file:set_cwd(NewDir),
  663:     {ok, #file_info{type=symlink}} = file:read_link_info(BadSymlink),
  664:     {ok, PointsTo} = file:read_link(BadSymlink),
  665:     {ok, #file_info{type=symlink}} = file:read_link_info(GoodSymlink),
  666:     {ok, AFile} = file:read_link(GoodSymlink),
  667:     Expected = list_to_binary(ALine),
  668:     {ok, Expected} = file:read_file(GoodSymlink),
  669: 
  670:     %% Extract the "dereferenced archive"  to a new directory.
  671: 
  672:     NewDirDeref = filename:join(Dir, "extracted_deref"),
  673:     ok = file:make_dir(NewDirDeref),
  674:     ok = erl_tar:extract(DerefTar, [{cwd, NewDirDeref}, verbose]),
  675: 
  676:     %% Verify that the files are there.
  677: 
  678:     ok = file:set_cwd(NewDirDeref),
  679:     {ok, #file_info{type=regular}} = file:read_link_info(GoodSymlink),
  680:     {ok, #file_info{type=regular}} = file:read_link_info(AFile),
  681:     {ok, Expected} = file:read_file(GoodSymlink),
  682:     {ok, Expected} = file:read_file(AFile),
  683: 
  684:     ok.
  685: 
  686: long_symlink(Dir) ->
  687:     Tar = filename:join(Dir, "long_symlink.tar"),
  688:     ok = file:set_cwd(Dir),
  689: 
  690:     AFile = "long_symlink",
  691:     RequiresPAX = "tmp/aarrghh/this/path/is/far/longer/than/one/hundred/characters/which/is/the/maximum/number/of/characters/allowed",
  692:     ok = file:make_symlink(RequiresPAX, AFile),
  693:     ok = erl_tar:create(Tar, [AFile], [verbose]),
  694:     false = is_ustar(Tar),
  695:     NewDir = filename:join(Dir, "extracted"),
  696:     _ = file:make_dir(NewDir),
  697:     ok = erl_tar:extract(Tar, [{cwd, NewDir}, verbose]),
  698:     ok = file:set_cwd(NewDir),
  699:     {ok, #file_info{type=symlink}} = file:read_link_info(AFile),
  700:     {ok, RequiresPAX} = file:read_link(AFile),
  701:     ok.
  702: 
  703: symlink_vulnerability(Dir) ->
  704:     ok = file:set_cwd(Dir),
  705:     ok = file:make_dir("tar"),
  706:     ok = file:set_cwd("tar"),
  707:     ok = file:make_symlink("..", "link"),
  708:     ok = file:write_file("../file", <<>>),
  709:     ok = erl_tar:create("../my.tar", ["link","link/file"]),
  710:     ok = erl_tar:tt("../my.tar"),
  711: 
  712:     ok = file:set_cwd(Dir),
  713:     delete_files(["file","tar"]),
  714:     ok = file:make_dir("tar"),
  715:     ok = file:set_cwd("tar"),
  716:     {error,{"..",unsafe_symlink}} = erl_tar:extract("../my.tar"),
  717: 
  718:     ok.
  719: 
  720: init(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  721:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  722:     ok = file:set_cwd(PrivDir),
  723:     Dir = filename:join(PrivDir, "init"),
  724:     ok = file:make_dir(Dir),
  725: 
  726:     [{FileOne,_,_}|_] = oac_files(),
  727:     TarOne = filename:join(Dir, "archive1.tar"),
  728:     {ok,Fd} = file:open(TarOne, [write]),
  729: 
  730:     %% If the arity of the fun is wrong, badarg should be returned
  731:     {error, badarg} = erl_tar:init(Fd, write, fun file_op_bad/1),
  732: 
  733:     %% Otherwise we should be good to go
  734:     {ok, Tar} = erl_tar:init(Fd, write, fun file_op/2),
  735:     ok = erl_tar:add(Tar, FileOne, []),
  736:     ok = erl_tar:close(Tar),
  737:     {ok, [FileOne]} = erl_tar:table(TarOne),
  738: 
  739:     verify_ports(Config).
  740: 
  741: file_op_bad(_) ->
  742:     throw({error, should_never_be_called}).
  743: 
  744: file_op(write, {Fd, Data}) ->
  745:     file:write(Fd, Data);
  746: file_op(position, {Fd, Pos}) ->
  747:     file:position(Fd, Pos);
  748: file_op(read2, {Fd, Size}) ->
  749:     file:read(Fd, Size);
  750: file_op(close, Fd) ->
  751:     file:close(Fd).
  752: 
  753: open_add_close(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  754:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  755:     ok = file:set_cwd(PrivDir),
  756:     Dir = filename:join(PrivDir, "open_add_close"),
  757:     ok = file:make_dir(Dir),
  758: 
  759:     [{FileOne,_,_},{FileTwo,_,_},{FileThree,_,_}] = oac_files(),
  760:     ADir = "empty_dir",
  761:     AnotherDir = "another_dir",
  762:     SomeContent = filename:join(AnotherDir, "some_content"),
  763:     ok = file:make_dir(ADir),
  764:     ok = file:make_dir(AnotherDir),
  765:     ok = file:make_dir(SomeContent),
  766: 
  767:     TarOne = filename:join(Dir, "archive1.tar"),
  768:     {ok,AD} = erl_tar:open(TarOne, [write]),
  769:     ok = erl_tar:add(AD, FileOne, []),
  770: 
  771:     %% Add with {NameInArchive,Name}
  772:     ok = erl_tar:add(AD, {"second file", FileTwo}, []),
  773: 
  774:     %% Add with {binary, Bin}
  775:     {ok,FileThreeBin} = file:read_file(FileThree),
  776:     ok = erl_tar:add(AD, {FileThree, FileThreeBin}, [verbose]),
  777: 
  778:     %% Add with Name
  779:     ok = erl_tar:add(AD, FileThree, "chunked", [{chunks,11411},verbose]),
  780:     ok = erl_tar:add(AD, ADir, [verbose]),
  781:     ok = erl_tar:add(AD, AnotherDir, [verbose]),
  782:     ok = erl_tar:close(AD),
  783:     case long_uid(Config) of
  784:         true -> ok;
  785:         false ->
  786:             true = is_ustar(TarOne)
  787:     end,
  788: 
  789:     ok = erl_tar:t(TarOne),
  790:     ok = erl_tar:tt(TarOne),
  791: 
  792:     Expected = {ok,[FileOne,"second file",FileThree,"chunked",ADir,SomeContent]},
  793:     Expected = erl_tar:table(TarOne),
  794: 
  795:     delete_files(["oac_file","oac_small","oac_big",Dir,AnotherDir,ADir]),
  796: 
  797:     verify_ports(Config).
  798: 
  799: oac_files() ->
  800:     Files = [{"oac_file", 1459, $x},
  801: 	     {"oac_small", 99, $w},
  802: 	     {"oac_big", 33896, $A}],
  803:     create_files(Files),
  804:     Files.
  805: 
  806: cooked_compressed(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  807:     %% Test that a compressed archive can be read in cooked mode.
  808:     DataDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
  809:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  810:     Name = filename:join(DataDir, "cooked_tar_problem.tar.gz"),
  811: 
  812:     %% Try table/2 and extract/2.
  813:     {ok,List} = erl_tar:table(Name, [cooked,compressed]),
  814:     io:format("~p\n", [List]),
  815:     19 = length(List),
  816:     ok = erl_tar:extract(Name, [cooked,compressed,{cwd,PrivDir}]),
  817: 
  818:     %% Clean up while at the same time testing that all file
  819:     %% were extracted as expected.
  820:     lists:foreach(fun(N) ->
  821: 			  File = filename:join(PrivDir, N),
  822: 			  io:format("Deleting: ~p\n", [File]),
  823: 			  ok = file:delete(File)
  824: 		  end, List),
  825: 
  826:     %% Clean up.
  827:     delete_files([filename:join(PrivDir, "ddll_SUITE_data")]),
  828: 
  829:     verify_ports(Config).
  830: 
  831: %% Test that an archive can be created directly from binaries and
  832: %% that an archive can be extracted into binaries.
  833: memory(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  834:     DataDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
  835: 
  836:     FileBins = [{"bar/fum", <<"BARFUM">>},{"foo", <<"FOO">>}],
  837:     Name1 = filename:join(DataDir, "memory.tar"),
  838:     ok = erl_tar:create(Name1, FileBins, [write,verbose]),
  839:     {ok,Extracted1} = erl_tar:extract(Name1, [memory,verbose]),
  840:     FileBins1 = lists:sort(Extracted1),
  841: 
  842:     io:format("FileBins: ~p\n", [FileBins]),
  843:     io:format("FileBins1: ~p\n", [FileBins1]),
  844:     FileBins = FileBins1,
  845: 
  846:     Name2 = filename:join(DataDir, "memory2.tar"),
  847:     {ok,Fd} = erl_tar:open(Name2, [write]),
  848:     [ok,ok] = [erl_tar:add(Fd, B, N, [write,verbose]) || {N,B} <- FileBins],
  849:     ok = erl_tar:close(Fd),
  850:     {ok,Extracted2} = erl_tar:extract(Name2, [memory,verbose]),
  851:     FileBins2 = lists:sort(Extracted2),
  852:     io:format("FileBins2: ~p\n", [FileBins2]),
  853:     FileBins = FileBins2,
  854: 
  855:     %% Clean up.
  856:     ok = delete_files([Name1,Name2]),
  857: 
  858:     verify_ports(Config).
  859: 
  860: read_other_implementations(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  861:     DataDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
  862:     Files = ["v7.tar", "gnu.tar", "bsd.tar",
  863:              "star.tar", "pax_mtime.tar"],
  864:     do_read_other_implementations(Files, DataDir),
  865:     verify_ports(Config).
  866: 
  867: do_read_other_implementations([], _DataDir) ->
  868:     ok;
  869: do_read_other_implementations([File|Rest], DataDir) ->
  870:     io:format("~nTrying ~s", [File]),
  871:     Full = filename:join(DataDir, File),
  872:     {ok, _} = erl_tar:table(Full),
  873:     {ok, _} = erl_tar:extract(Full, [memory]),
  874:     do_read_other_implementations(Rest, DataDir).
  875: 
  876: %% test block padding with compressed tar from bsdtar or tape
  877: bsdtgz(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  878:     DataDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
  879:     File = "example_pad.tgz",
  880:     Full = filename:join(DataDir, File),
  881:     io:format("~nTrying ~s", [File]),
  882:     Table = ["autofs.conf","rpc"],
  883:     {ok, Table} = erl_tar:table(Full, [compressed]),
  884:     {ok, Bin} = file:read_file(Full),
  885:     {ok, Table} = erl_tar:table({binary, Bin}, [compressed]),
  886:     verify_ports(Config).
  887: 
  888: %% Test handling of sparse files
  889: sparse(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  890:     DataDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
  891:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  892:     Sparse01Empty = "sparse01_empty.tar",
  893:     Sparse01 = "sparse01.tar",
  894:     Sparse10Empty = "sparse10_empty.tar",
  895:     Sparse10 = "sparse10.tar",
  896:     do_sparse([Sparse01Empty, Sparse01, Sparse10Empty, Sparse10], DataDir, PrivDir),
  897:     verify_ports(Config).
  898: 
  899: do_sparse([], _DataDir, _PrivDir) ->
  900:     ok;
  901: do_sparse([Name|Rest], DataDir, PrivDir) ->
  902:     io:format("~nTrying sparse file ~s", [Name]),
  903:     Full = filename:join(DataDir, Name),
  904:     {ok, [_]} = erl_tar:table(Full),
  905:     {ok, _} = erl_tar:extract(Full, [memory]),
  906:     do_sparse(Rest, DataDir, PrivDir).
  907: 
  908: %% Test filenames with characters outside the US ASCII range.
  909: unicode(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  910:     run_unicode_node(Config, ["+fnu"]),
  911:     case has_transparent_naming() of
  912: 	true ->
  913: 	    run_unicode_node(Config, ["+fnl"]);
  914: 	false ->
  915: 	    ok
  916:     end.
  917: 
  918: run_unicode_node(Config, Args) ->
  919:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  920:     {ok, Peer, Node} = ?CT_PEER(Args),
  921:     ok = rpc:call(Node, erlang, apply,
  922: 		  [fun() -> do_unicode(PrivDir) end,[]]),
  923:     peer:stop(Peer),
  924:     ok.
  925: 
  926: has_transparent_naming() ->
  927:     case os:type() of
  928: 	{unix,darwin} -> false;
  929: 	{unix,_} -> true;
  930: 	_ -> false
  931:     end.
  932: 
  933: do_unicode(PrivDir) ->
  934:     ok = file:set_cwd(PrivDir),
  935:     case file:make_dir("unicde") of
  936:         ok ->
  937:             Names = lists:sort(unicode_create_files()),
  938:             Tar = "unicde.tar",
  939:             ok = erl_tar:create(Tar, ["unicde"], []),
  940: 
  941:             %% Unicode filenames require PAX format.
  942:             false = is_ustar(Tar),
  943:             {ok,Names0} = erl_tar:table(Tar, []),
  944:             Names = lists:sort(Names0),
  945:             _ = [ok = file:delete(Name) || Name <- Names],
  946:             ok = erl_tar:extract(Tar),
  947:             _ = [{ok,_} = file:read_file(Name) || Name <- Names],
  948:             _ = [ok = file:delete(Name) || Name <- Names],
  949:             ok = file:del_dir("unicde");
  950:         {error,eilseq} ->
  951:             %% The FS (eg zfs) does not support transparent naming
  952:             ok
  953:     end,
  954:     ok.
  955: 
  956: unicode_create_files() ->
  957:     FileA = "unicde/smrgsbord",
  958:     ok = file:write_file(FileA, "yum!\n"),
  959:     [FileA|case file:native_name_encoding() of
  960: 	       utf8 ->
  961: 		   FileB = "unicde/ !",
  962: 		   ok = file:write_file(FileB, "But almost empty.\n"),
  963: 		   [FileB];
  964: 	       latin1 ->
  965: 		   []
  966: 	   end].
  967: 
  968: leading_slash(Config) ->
  969:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  970:     Dir = filename:join(PrivDir, ?FUNCTION_NAME),
  971:     TarFile = filename:join(Dir, "leading_slash.tar"),
  972:     ok = filelib:ensure_dir(TarFile),
  973:     {ok,Fd} = erl_tar:open(TarFile, [write]),
  974:     TarMemberName = "e/d/c/b/a_member",
  975:     TarMemberNameAbs = "/" ++ TarMemberName,
  976:     Contents = <<"contents\n">>,
  977:     ok = erl_tar:add(Fd, Contents, TarMemberNameAbs, [verbose]),
  978:     ok = erl_tar:close(Fd),
  979: 
  980:     ok = erl_tar:extract(TarFile, [{cwd,Dir}]),
  981: 
  982:     {ok,Contents} = file:read_file(filename:join(Dir, TarMemberName)),
  983:     ok.
  984: 
  985: dotdot(Config) ->
  986:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  987:     Dir = filename:join(PrivDir, ?FUNCTION_NAME),
  988:     ok = file:make_dir(Dir),
  989:     Tar = filename:join(Dir, "dotdot.tar"),
  990:     {ok,Fd} = erl_tar:open(Tar, [write]),
  991:     BeamFile = code:which(?MODULE),
  992:     ok = erl_tar:add(Fd, BeamFile, "a/./../../some_file", []),
  993:     ok = erl_tar:close(Fd),
  994: 
  995:     {error,{_,unsafe_path=Error}} = erl_tar:extract(Tar, [{cwd,Dir}]),
  996:     false = filelib:is_regular(filename:join(PrivDir, "some_file")),
  997:     io:format("~s\n", [erl_tar:format_error(Error)]),
  998: 
  999:     ok.
 1000: 
 1001: roundtrip_metadata(Config) ->
 1002:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 1003:     Dir = filename:join(PrivDir, ?FUNCTION_NAME),
 1004:     ok = file:make_dir(Dir),
 1005: 
 1006:     do_roundtrip_metadata(Dir, "name-does-not-matter"),
 1007:     ok.
 1008: 
 1009: do_roundtrip_metadata(Dir, File) ->
 1010:     Tar = filename:join(Dir, atom_to_list(?FUNCTION_NAME)++".tar"),
 1011:     BeamFile = code:which(?MODULE),
 1012:     {ok,Fd} = erl_tar:open(Tar, [write]),
 1013:     ok = erl_tar:add(Fd, BeamFile, File, []),
 1014:     ok = erl_tar:close(Fd),
 1015: 
 1016:     ok = erl_tar:extract(Tar, [{cwd,Dir}]),
 1017: 
 1018:     %% Make sure that size and modification times are the same
 1019:     %% on all platforms.
 1020:     {ok,OrigInfo} = file:read_file_info(BeamFile),
 1021:     ExtractedFile = filename:join(Dir, File),
 1022:     {ok,ExtractedInfo} = file:read_file_info(ExtractedFile),
 1023:     #file_info{size=Size,mtime=Mtime,type=regular} = OrigInfo,
 1024:     #file_info{size=Size,mtime=Mtime,type=regular} = ExtractedInfo,
 1025: 
 1026:     %% On Unix platforms more fields are expected to be the same.
 1027:     case os:type() of
 1028:         {unix,_} ->
 1029:             #file_info{access=Access,mode=Mode} = OrigInfo,
 1030:             #file_info{access=Access,mode=Mode} = ExtractedInfo,
 1031:             ok;
 1032:         _ ->
 1033:             ok
 1034:     end.
 1035: 
 1036: apply_file_info_opts(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1037:     ok = file:set_cwd(proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config)),
 1038: 
 1039:     ok = file:make_dir("empty_directory"),
 1040:     ok = file:write_file("file", "contents"),
 1041: 
 1042:     Opts = [{atime, 0}, {mtime, 0}, {ctime, 0}, {uid, 0}, {gid, 0}],
 1043:     TarFile = "reproducible.tar",
 1044:     {ok, Tar} = erl_tar:open(TarFile, [write]),
 1045:     ok = erl_tar:add(Tar, "file", Opts),
 1046:     ok = erl_tar:add(Tar, "empty_directory", Opts),
 1047:     ok = erl_tar:add(Tar, <<"contents">>, "memory_file", Opts),
 1048:     erl_tar:close(Tar),
 1049: 
 1050:     ok = file:make_dir("extracted"),
 1051:     erl_tar:extract(TarFile, [{cwd, "extracted"}]),
 1052: 
 1053:     {ok, #file_info{mtime=0}} =
 1054:         file:read_file_info("extracted/empty_directory", [{time, posix}]),
 1055:     {ok, #file_info{mtime=0}} =
 1056:         file:read_file_info("extracted/file", [{time, posix}]),
 1057:     {ok, #file_info{mtime=0}} =
 1058:         file:read_file_info("extracted/memory_file", [{time, posix}]),
 1059: 
 1060:     ok.
 1061: 
 1062: %% Delete the given list of files.
 1063: delete_files([]) -> ok;
 1064: delete_files([Item|Rest]) ->
 1065:     case file:delete(Item) of
 1066: 	ok ->
 1067: 	    delete_files(Rest);
 1068: 	{error,eperm} ->
 1069: 	    file:change_mode(Item, 8#777),
 1070: 	    delete_files(filelib:wildcard(filename:join(Item, "*"))),
 1071: 	    file:del_dir(Item),
 1072: 	    ok;
 1073: 	{error,eacces} ->
 1074: 	    %% We'll see about that!
 1075: 	    file:change_mode(Item, 8#777),
 1076: 	    case file:delete(Item) of
 1077: 		ok -> ok;
 1078: 		{error,_} ->
 1079: 		    erlang:yield(),
 1080: 		    file:change_mode(Item, 8#777),
 1081: 		    file:delete(Item),
 1082: 		    ok
 1083: 	    end;
 1084: 	{error,_} -> ok
 1085:     end,
 1086:     delete_files(Rest).
 1087: 
 1088: %% Move to a temporary directory with as short name as possible and
 1089: %% execute Fun. Remove the directory and any files in it afterwards.
 1090: %% This is necessary because pathnames on Windows may be limited to
 1091: %% 260 characters.
 1092: run_in_short_tempdir(Config, Fun) ->
 1093:     {ok,Cwd} = file:get_cwd(),
 1094:     PrivDir0 = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 1095: 
 1096:     %% Normalize name to make sure that there is no slash at the end.
 1097:     PrivDir = filename:absname(PrivDir0),
 1098: 
 1099:     %% We need a base directory with a much shorter pathname than
 1100:     %% priv_dir. We KNOW that priv_dir is located four levels below
 1101:     %% the directory that common_test puts the ct_run.* directories
 1102:     %% in. That fact is not documented, but a usually reliable source
 1103:     %% assured me that the directory structure is unlikely to change
 1104:     %% in future versions of common_test because of backwards
 1105:     %% compatibility (tools developed by users of common_test depend
 1106:     %% on the current directory layout).
 1107:     Base = lists:foldl(fun(_, D) ->
 1108: 			       filename:dirname(D)
 1109: 		       end, PrivDir, [1,2,3,4]),
 1110: 
 1111:     Dir = make_temp_dir(Base, 0),
 1112:     ok = file:set_cwd(Dir),
 1113:     io:format("Running test in ~s\n", [Dir]),
 1114:     try
 1115: 	Fun()
 1116:     after
 1117: 	file:set_cwd(Cwd),
 1118: 	delete_files([Dir])
 1119:     end.
 1120: 
 1121: make_temp_dir(Base, I) ->
 1122:     Name = filename:join(Base, integer_to_list(I, 36)),
 1123:     case file:make_dir(Name) of
 1124: 	ok -> Name;
 1125: 	{error,eexist} -> make_temp_dir(Base, I+1)
 1126:     end.
 1127: 
 1128: %% Test that the given tar file is a plain USTAR archive,
 1129: %% without any PAX extensions.
 1130: is_ustar(File) ->
 1131:     {ok,Bin} = file:read_file(File),
 1132:     <<_:257/binary,"ustar",0,_/binary>> = Bin,
 1133:     <<_:156/binary,Type:8,_/binary>> = Bin,
 1134:     case Type of
 1135:         $x -> false;
 1136:         $g -> false;
 1137:         _ -> true
 1138:     end.
 1139: 
 1140: 
 1141: verify_ports(Config) ->
 1142:     PortsBefore = proplists:get_value(ports, Config),
 1143:     PortsAfter = ordsets:from_list(erlang:ports()),
 1144:     case ordsets:subtract(PortsAfter, PortsBefore) of
 1145:         [] ->
 1146:             ok;
 1147:         [_|_]=Rem ->
 1148:             error({leaked_ports,Rem})
 1149:     end.
 1150: 
 1151: uid_config(Config) ->
 1152:     DataDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 1153:     Long = filename:join(DataDir, "long_names.tar"),
 1154:     {ok, FileInfo} = file:read_file_info(Long),
 1155:     Uid = FileInfo#file_info.uid,
 1156:     Octal = integer_to_list(Uid, 8),
 1157:     [{longuid, length(Octal) > 7}|Config].
 1158: 
 1159: long_uid(Config) ->
 1160:     proplists:get_value(longuid, Config).
